snippet: On July 25, 1909, the French aviator Louis Blériot climbed into a monoplane in Calais, France, and flew to Dover, England. That first crossing of the English Channel tapped into emotions that are familiar today: excitement over technology's ability...
abstract: On July 25, 1909, the French aviator Louis Blériot climbed into a monoplane in Calais, France, and flew to Dover, England. That first crossing of the English Channel tapped into emotions that are familiar today: excitement over technology's ability to weave the world together, but anxiety over whether this was an altogether good thing.
